intro: Primula angustidens, commonly known as the narrowleaf primrose, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring upright stems covered in velvety, dark green leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, or purple, which bloom in early spring. Its foliage is characterized by narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly serrated edge. Primula angustidens is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in cool, moist environments.
